results.title: High Sierra
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, First National Pictures, Hal B Wallis and Raoul Walsh
results.brief_description: Newly released from prison, bank robber “Mad Dog” Roy Earle (Humphrey Bogart) agrees to one last caper, out of gratitude to an old gangland pal. However, Earle has changed after eight years in gaol. He is torn between his hard-boiled, brutal side and more caring, compassionate feelings, which ultimately cause his downfall. When getaway plans misfire, Earle flees to the High Sierras. In a defiant last stand he is trapped at 11,000 feet with an army of police waiting below.

results.title: High school II [NTSC]
results.brief_description: This is a film about Central Park East Secondary School (CPESS), a successful alternative high school in New York’s Spanish Harlem, 95% of whose graduates go on to four-year colleges. The film illustrates the School’s emphasis on “Habits of Mind” (weighing evidence; awareness of multiple points of view; seeing connections and relationships; speculating on possibilities; and assessing values). Sequences illustrating the School’s approach to learning include: classroom activities in the humanities and sciences; family conferences; discussions of race, class, and gender; faculty meetings; disciplinary problems; sex education; conflict resolution by students; and student council meetings. The film shows the students learning how to learn, how to reason and how to critique complex issues requiring collaboration, personal responsibility and a tolerance for uncertainty.

results.title: High school geography: new insights
results.brief_description: This is a training film to show teachers how to use some parts of the High Schools Geography Project, particularly the “Geography in an urban age” unit. It covers some of the teaching strategies but does not follow through the unit step by step.

results.title: High rolling = High rolling in a hot corvette
results.creator_credit: Hexagon, Tim Burstall and Igor Auzins
results.brief_description: Two friends in North Queensland leave their jobs with a boxing troupe and a shooting gallery and turn to crime. A ‘road movie’ with a soundtrack by the pop group, Sherbet, “High Rolling” set itself firmly in the sunshine and sleaziness of the Queensland coast. Produced on a small budget with an imported American star (Joseph Bottoms), it was the first feature by Melbourne television director, Igor Auzins. Cast also includes Grigor Taylor, Judy Davis and Wendy Hughes.

results.title: High pressure drums
results.brief_description: A detailed account of the manufacture of high pressure boiler drums in one of Britain’s leading engineering works. Scenes of the installation of drums during the construction of a new atomic power plant show one of the many fields of industry in which this article is an essential component.

results.title: High noon (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Stanley Kramer and Fred Zimmerman
results.brief_description: A retired marshall is forced to take up his badge and guns again when a killer he has sent to jail returns to town seeking revenge. The townspeople refuse to help and his new bride wants him to run away from the fight. The marshall meets the killer and his three accomplices at high noon in one of the most suspenseful and thrilling gunfights ever filmed. Cast includes Gary Cooper and Grace Kelly. Based on the story ‘The Tin star’ by John W. Cunningham.

results.title: High mountain venture
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre, Ross Campbell and Ross Matthews
results.brief_description: Shows the activities offered to boys at the Education Department’s school camp at Bogong, Victoria. A balanced program of conservation studies and challenging physical activities is the highlight of this very popular camp. Suitable for tertiary level.

results.title: High mark
results.creator_credit: Australian Football Council, Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: A record of the 1947 Grand Final match between two league teams - Carlton and Essendon. The game is fought to an exciting finish, with only one point between the winning and losing team - Carlton 86 points to Essendon 85 points. Narrated by Eric Welch
